_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Acme Supply Company  --  Malta Bend

1.  Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of Acme Supply Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occure, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Saline County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and is distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for that purpose.

3.  Accidental Release Prevention Program.  The facility follows the provision of the U. S. Occupatioal Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our State regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.

4.  Five-Year Accident History.  There have been on accidental releases of anhydrous ammoina during the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at this facility, nor to our knowledge,  there has not been any acciental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.  Emergency Response Program.  The facility has a written Emergency Action Plan in accordance with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assiss the conditions at the facility.  There are specific safety
changes ongoing at this time, the replacement of emergency shutoff valves, and inspection of nurse tanks.
